briefTitle: Methotrexate-Inadequate Response Autoinjector Device Sub Study
officialTitle: Substudy-A Phase IIIB Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Abatacept Administered Subcutaneously and Intravenously in Subjects With Rheumatoid Arthritis, Receiving Background Methotrexate, and Experiencing an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate
summary: The purpose of this study is to implement a substudy in approximately 120 rheumatoid arthritis (RA) subjects to compare the steady-state serum trough concentration (Cminss), Cmax and area under the curve (AUC) during the dosing interval (TAU) of subcutaneous (SC) Abatacept injection of 125 mg via the autoinjector and via the BD Hypakâ„¢ Physiolis prefilled syringe.

primaryOutcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Analysis: Adjusted Geometric Mean Observed Serum Trough Concentration at Steady State (Cminss) of Abatacept Using a Prefilled Syringe (Measured on Day 29) and Using an Autoinjector (Measured on Day 113)

effectByArm.arm: 125 mg Abatacept SC Using Prefilled Syringe - Day 29
125 mg Abatacept SC Using Autoinjector - Day 113
